snippet: The head of the Organization for the Prohibition of Chemical Weapons said a team of 15 inspectors had begun to visit weapons sites in the country.
abstract: Ahmet Uzumcu, director general of the Organization for the Prohibition of Chemical Weapons, which is overseeing the destruction of Syria’s chemical weapons arsenal, says that a team of 15 inspectors has begun to visit sites and that the Syrian authorities are being cooperative.

byline.contributor: Michael R. Gordon contributed reporting from Washington.

lead_paragraph: The head of the Organization for the Prohibition of Chemical Weapons said a team of 15 inspectors had begun to visit weapons sites in the country.

headline.main: Watchdog Says Syria Has Been Cooperative on Weapons
headline.print_headline: Weapons Group Calls Syrian Authorities Cooperative

keywords.name: organizations
keywords.value: Organization for the Prohibition of Chemical Weapons
